biography.bio: Dan van Husen had a certain look about him back then in the 1970s and all the last 40 years have done is add a sage, aged, mature wisened aura to him. He has appeared in twenty-three Italo Westerns in six or seven years and then he branched out and tackled more challenging roles and genres. Not that many from the Spaghetti Western days ever studied or hit acting with the tenacity that he has done up until the present.
biography.name: Dan van Husen

biography.bio: Heinz Bennent was born on July 18, 1921 in Stolberg, Germany as Heinrich August Bennent. He was an actor, known for Possession (1981), The Tin Drum (1979) and Le dernier métro (1980). He was married to Paulette Renou. He died on October 12, 2011 in Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland.
biography.name: Heinz Bennent

biography.bio: Rudolf Schündler was born on April 17, 1906 in Leipzig, Germany as Rudolf Ernst Paul Schündler. He was an actor and director, known for The Exorcist (1973), Suspiria (1977) and Le testament du docteur Mabuse (1933). He was married to Christine Laszar. He died on December 12, 1988 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany.
biography.name: Rudolf Schündler

biography.bio: German character actor on screen, TV and stage. Trained in Brunswick he had his stage debut in Freiburg. Later he was on stage in Frankfurt and since 1975 in Munich. After more and more bigger filmparts since 1949 he played his only leading role in The Kidnapping of Miss Nylon (1959). Then he became a very busy supporting actor in over fifty movies. Director Billy Wilder gave him the part as Chauffeur Fritz in One, Two, Three (1961) opposite James Cagney. He starred in several TV serials in Germany, best known as Inspector Janot in the longtime serial Dem Täter auf der Spur (1967) between 1967-73 and in Lutz & Hardy (1994). His most recognized and superb role was as Vater Kempowski in Tadellöser & Wolff (1975). He had his last appearance as guest-star in the final episode of Inspecteur Derrick (1974) in 1998.
biography.name: Karl Lieffen

biography.bio: Antje Hagen was born on August 10, 1938 in Pethau, Germany. She is known for her work on Le Tourbillon de l'amour (2005), Das Fräulein (1967) and Alle Jahre wieder: Die Familie Semmeling (1976). She was previously married to Günter Jendrich.
biography.name: Antje Hagen

biography.bio: Irm Hermann was born on October 4, 1942 in Munich, Germany as Irmgard Hermann. She is an actress and assistant director, known for Ali: Fear Eats the Soul (1974), Le marchand des quatre saisons (1972) and The Downfall of Berlin: Anonyma (2008). She is married to Dietmar Roberg. They have two children.
biography.name: Irm Hermann

biography.bio: Christine Kaufmann was born on January 11, 1945 in Lengdorf, Styria, Austria as Christine Maria Kaufmann. She was an actress, known for Bagdad Cafe (1987), Taras Bulba (1962) and Town Without Pity (1961). She was married to Klaus Zey, Reno Eckstein, Achim Lenz and Tony Curtis. She died on March 28, 2017 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Christine Kaufmann

biography.bio: Peter Kern was born on February 13, 1949 in Vienna, Austria. He was an actor and director, known for Initiation (2009), Belief, Love, Death (2012) and Hitler, un film d'Allemagne (1977). He died on August 26, 2015 in Austria.
biography.name: Peter Kern

biography.bio: Charles Regnier was born on July 22, 1914 in Fribourg, Switzerland as Karl Friedrich Anton Hermann Regnier. He was an actor and writer, known for Mordkommission (1973), Monsieur Gangster (1963) and In der Sache J. Robert Oppenheimer (1964). He was married to Sonja Ziemann and Pamela Wedekind. He died on September 13, 2001 in Bad Wiessee, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Charles Regnier

biography.bio: Otto Sander was born on June 30, 1941 in Hanover, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Wings of Desire (1987), Das Boot (1981) and Faraway, So Close! (1993). He was married to Monika Hansen. He died on September 12, 2013 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Otto Sander
